title: NA vs. EU Rift Rivals stats breakdown

replies.body:
(lets get this started)


So what i'm seeing is... NA > EU ?
There's 46 + 20 dragons taken so that's 66, but if you count up each elemental that's 76? Cool.
Perhaps those are dragons that spawned? Not every dragon spawned is killed?
I'm guessing the missing 10 are Elder Dragons, but I could be wrong and it's just a typo :)

Samux I ward per game average?
Perfect for NA Gold ELO.

> [{quoted}](name=FamousTG,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=oxqXWUYA,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-07-11T14:32:57.083+0000)
>
> Samux I ward per game average?
> Perfect for NA Gold ELO.

See.  Even the pros know it's the support's job to ward the whole map.
FNC were the only EU team to take dragons, and they only managed to get 2 thru the entire tourney
UoL took dragons, Its FNC and G2 that ignored drake.
EU dominated in deaths.  WE'RE NUMBER ONE!!  Oh wait.  That's a bad thing.
20 - 2 = Wait, something's not adding up here.....
It's almost even if you throw out G2 and TSM.
Yea, if you throw the best NA team and the worst EU team. That would make sense. But sadly for EU that"s not how it happened. NA>EU
With this win TSM became the very first ever NA team to win a Riot sponsored International tournament. Way to go TSM!{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
If you include the finals, NA won 15/21 games...5/7, the meme is complete
What I am seeing is Xspecial should of been mvp in group stage not mike yeung
